oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-03-29 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 29, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performers the Everly Brothers, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 964th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Reeves; Jordanaires; Rod Brasfield; Everly Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- Overnight (Jim Reeves, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces the Everly Brothers -- Claudette (Everly Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sally Ann (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Jim Reeves talks -- I'll Fly Away (Jim Reeves, Jordanaires) -- Jim Reeves introduces Chet Atkins -- Please Don't Talk About Me When I'm Gone (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Reeves, Jim; Everly Brothers; Everly, Don, 1937-; Everly, Phil, 1939-2014
